Mnemonic: Keen ears (きいて) please! Listen up when you see 聞いてください.
Imagine a kite (かい) writing (書) a note—please write (ください) it down!
Imagine a librarian saying, “Please read (yawn) the book” — よんでください (yo-n-de-kuda-sai).

Kanji: Ｘページを開けて下さい
Kana: Ｘページをあけてください
Mnemonic: Imagine saying “A key (あけて) opens X pages—please open page X!”
Imagine politely asking: "Please SAY it!"—like gently saying "EAT (いって) those words, kudasai!"
Imagine saying "please look" (みてください) as you put on big glasses to 見-see clearly—"Mi-te" is "Me, take a look, please!"

Kana: ペアではなしてください
Mnemonic: Picture two pears (ペア) chatting politely—“Please speak in pairs!”
